intro: Triticum vulgare var. sericeum, commonly known as silky wheat, is a variant of common wheat characterized by its silky, glabrous lemma hairs. It is a grass species native to temperate regions of Europe and Asia. The plant typically grows to a height of 60–120 cm, with slender, erect stems and narrow, linear leaves. Its inflorescence consists of a spike made up of spikelets, each bearing a single floret. This variety is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its delicate appearance and is also used in some traditional agricultural practices.
